      • isTimestampAndNonceValid

        public boolean isTimestampAndNonceValid(java.sql.Timestamp date,
                                        byte[] nonce)
        It will check if the Timestamp is fresh (if it was created within TIME_INTERVAL_VALID_REQUEST_MS from the actual time) and if the pair Timestamp,Nonce was already seen.
        Parameters:
        date -
        nonce -
        Returns:
        boolean true if its valid, false if it isn't

      • digest

        public byte[] digest(byte[] toBeDigested)
              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        It returns SHA-2 digest of the given byte[] Don't use this method if you are going to use makeDigitalSignature next. Don't forget SHA-2 is still secure :D
        Parameters:
        toBeDigested - - bytes to be digested
        Returns:
        byte[] SHA-2 of toBeDigested
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • getPublicKeyFingerprint

        public byte[] getPublicKeyFingerprint(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
                               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        It digests the public key using sha-2 and return its result.
        Parameters:
        publicKey -
        Returns:
        byte[] with SHA-2 of publicKey
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException

      • makeDigitalSignature

        public byte[] makeDigitalSignature(byte[] bytesToSign,
                                   java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
                            throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                   java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                   java.security.SignatureException
        It digests the message and signs that digest with senders private key. This method does everything, so you don't need to use digest method before.
        Parameters:
        bytesToSign -
        privateKey -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.SignatureException

      • verifyDigitalSignature

        public boolean verifyDigitalSignature(byte[] signedDigest,
                                      byte[] bytesToBeVerified,
                                      java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
                               throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                      java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                      java.security.SignatureException
        Checks if the signedDigest was indeed the digest from the message sign with senders private key. Ofc we are checking with a public key :D We are not hackers :D
        Parameters:
        signedDigest -
        bytesToBeVerified -
        publicKey -
        Returns:
        boolean - true if it's authentic, false if it isn't
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.SignatureException

      • runAES

        public byte[] runAES(byte[] bytesToEncrypt,
                     java.security.Key aesKey,
                     byte[] iv,
                     int mode)
              throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                     javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                     java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                     java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                     javax.crypto.BadPaddingException,
                     javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        It encrypts/decrypts using AES-CBC bytesToEncrypt using aesKey. It will return the ciphered or the plain text If aesKey has not the proper Padding (PKCS5Padding) an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        bytesToEncrypt -
        aesKey -
        iv -
        mode - - Cipher.ENCRYPT_MODE to encrypt; Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE to decrypt
        Returns:
        byte[]
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
